segments.en: And today we're bringing you our great suspense scary series.
segments.cn: 今天我们为你带来我们精彩的悬疑恐怖系列。

segments.en: Our thriller, New Guy in Town Part 4.
segments.cn: 我们的惊悚片，《城里的新家伙》第四部分。

segments.en: Alright, well, I don't want to give you any hints about what will happen in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，我不想给你们任何关于这个对话会发生什么的提示。

segments.en: So let's listen to our dialogue and then we'll come back and talk about some of the great vocabulary.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听听对话，然后我们再回来讨论一些很棒的词汇。

segments.en: Alright, drag her over here and help me tie her up.
segments.cn: 好吧，把她拖过来，帮我把她绑起来。

segments.en: I can't believe she fell for it.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信她上当了。

segments.en: She is a lot more gullible than I thought.
segments.cn: 她比我想象的要容易上当得多。

segments.en: Well, you gotta admit, my acting was brilliant.
segments.cn: 好吧，你得承认，我的表演很精彩。

segments.en: I was the one that convinced her to come.
The cat's out of the bag, you witch.
segments.cn: 猫已经出袋了，你这个女巫。

segments.en: Yeah, Lois, we know who you are.

segments.cn: 现在我们想要一些答案。

segments.en: Well, I certainly didn't see that one coming.
segments.cn: 好吧，我真没想到会这样。

segments.en: I know, everyone thought that Armand was a vampire.
segments.cn: 我知道，大家都认为Armand是吸血鬼。

segments.en: And now it turns out that they were acting.
segments.cn: 现在看来他们是在演戏。

segments.en: Strange things happen here on EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 在EnglishPod这里发生奇怪的事情。

segments.en: Alright, so why don't we take a look at some of the language that we saw in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们来看看在语言收获中看到的一些语言。

segments.en: Language Takeaway is three words for you here that we heard in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 语言收获是我们在对话中听到的三个词。

segments.en: And the first one, Armand tells Ellen to drag her over here.
segments.cn: 第一个，Armand告诉Ellen把她拖过来。

segments.en: So when you drag something or somebody... You pull them across the floor, or pull them across the ground.
segments.cn: 所以当你拖动某物或某人时……你把他们拉过地板，或拉过地面。

segments.en: Pull them, but you don't actually pick them up, right?
segments.cn: 拉他们，但你实际上并没有把他们抬起来，对吧？

segments.en: Their body is still touching the ground.
segments.cn: 他们的身体仍然接触地面。

segments.en: Okay, so just imagine if you have a really heavy suitcase, it doesn't have any wheels, you gotta drag it across the floor.
segments.cn: 好吧，想象一下如果你有一个非常重的行李箱，没有轮子，你得把它拖过地板。

segments.en: Yeah, it's happened to me too.
Alright, and then he says, tie her up.
To use rope and put it around a person so that they cannot move.
segments.cn: 用绳子把它放在一个人身上，这样他们就不能动。

segments.en: Right, so you take rope, you tie a person up.
segments.cn: 对，所以你拿绳子，把一个人绑起来。

segments.en: And it's always used like this, right?
So our singular would be fool.
segments.cn: 所以我们的单数是傻瓜。

segments.en: Well a fool is a stupid person.
Right, a person that doesn't know something or an ignorant person.
segments.cn: 对，一个不知道某事或无知的人。

segments.en: Alright, well Lois thinks that Armand and Ellen are fools here.
Apparently she got really angry and managed to escape from the chair or whatever.
segments.cn: 显然她非常生气，设法从椅子上逃脱了。

segments.en: Well the dialogue was a little bit fast.
There was a lot of sound effects as well.
So let's listen to this dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以让我们再听一遍这个对话。

segments.en: We're gonna slow it down a little bit and I'm sure it's gonna be a little bit easier to understand.
segments.cn: 我们会放慢一点，我相信会更容易理解。

segments.en: Alright, drag her over here and help me tie her up.
segments.cn: 好吧，把她拖过来，帮我把她绑起来。

segments.en: I can't believe she fell for it.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信她上当了。

segments.en: She is a lot more gullible than I thought.
segments.cn: 她比我想象的要容易上当得多。

segments.en: Well, you gotta admit my acting was brilliant.
segments.cn: 好吧，你得承认，我的表演很精彩。

segments.en: I was the one that convinced her to come.
The cat's out of the bag, you witch.
segments.cn: 猫已经出袋了，你这个女巫。
现在，我们想要一些答案。

segments.en: You don't know who you're dealing with.
segments.cn: 你不知道你在和谁打交道。

segments.en: Well Marco, I noticed in this dialogue there's a lot of words and phrases that we can use to talk about lying or fooling somebody.
segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，我注意到在这个对话中有很多我们可以用来谈论撒谎或愚弄某人的词和短语。

segments.en: There is a lot of language about lying, so let's take a look at it in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 关于撒谎有很多语言，我们来看看流利构建器中的内容。

segments.en: Alright, so in Fluency Builder today, let's take a look at four phrases.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在流利构建器中，我们来看看四个短语。

segments.en: The first one, fell for it.
I can't believe she fell for it.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信她掉进了圈套。

segments.en: Okay, so it's not that she physically fell, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，她并不是字面上摔倒，对吧？

segments.en: I know that we have some examples so we can understand this phrase, fell for it, a little bit better.
segments.cn: 我知道我们有一些例子可以帮助我们更好地理解这个短语，掉进了圈套。

segments.en: You might seem like a nice guy, but don't fall for it.
segments.cn: 你可能看起来是个好人，但别上当。

segments.en: I can't believe I fell for your lies.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信我相信了你的谎言。

segments.en: I told my mom I was going to the library and she fell for it.
segments.cn: 我告诉我妈妈我要去图书馆，她信了。

segments.en: Alright, well that's a lot clearer to me.
segments.cn: 好吧，这对我来说清楚多了。

segments.en: I noticed that we have the preposition, it, here.
segments.cn: 我注意到这里有介词 it。

segments.en: Yeah, it is at the end.
And it's referring to the lie.
But you wouldn't say she fell for the story.
segments.cn: 但你不会说她相信了这个故事。

segments.en: You would say she fell for it.
Yes, so these three words always, always, always go together.
segments.cn: 是的，这三个词总是、总是、总是一起使用。

segments.en: Okay, let's take a look at our second word.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们来看看第二个词。

segments.en: So Ellen thinks that Lois was gullible.
segments.cn: 所以艾伦认为洛伊斯很容易上当。

segments.en: A gullible person is somebody that always believes.
segments.cn: 易受骗的人是总是相信的人。

segments.en: Yes, they always fall for it.
Yeah, they believe anything you say.
segments.cn: 是的，他们相信你说的任何话。

segments.en: So I know you were a little bit gullible when you were younger, right?
segments.cn: 所以我知道你年轻时有点容易上当，对吧？

segments.en: You know what, my grandmother used to tell me every year she would say, oh I'm 35.
segments.cn: 你知道吗，我奶奶每年都告诉我，她会说，哦，我35岁。

segments.en: And I really believed her until I was about 12 years old.
segments.cn: 我真的相信她，直到我大约12岁。

segments.en: Wow, so you were really gullible.
segments.cn: 哇，你真是太容易上当了。

segments.en: Okay, now let's look at the next phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们来看下一个短语。

segments.en: The cat's out of the bag.
The cat is out of the bag.
The cat is out of the bag.
Okay, so again it's not literal.
It's not like you had a cat in a bag and you let it out.
segments.cn: 不是说你有一只猫在袋子里然后放出来。

segments.en: A nice idiom here meaning the truth is out.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的习语，意思是真相已经揭晓。

segments.en: Okay, so the cat's out of the bag.
So Lois was pretending to be a normal housewife.
segments.cn: 所以洛伊斯假装是一个普通的家庭主妇。

segments.en: Let's listen to some examples of how we would use pretending.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些关于如何使用假装的例子。

segments.en: Pretend that you're my boyfriend and he'll go away.
segments.cn: 假装你是我的男朋友，他就会离开。

segments.en: I can't believe Lucy pretended to be sick.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信露西假装生病。

segments.en: Don't pretend that everything is okay.
Okay, so pretending is acting like you are somebody that you are not.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以假装就是表现得像你不是的人。

segments.en: Yes, or yeah it's sort of like acting a lie.
segments.cn: 是的，或者是，嗯，这有点像演一个谎言。

segments.en: Okay, so for example on Halloween everyone dresses up as a monster or spider-man or something so everyone pretends to be that character.
segments.cn: 好吧，比如在万圣节，每个人都打扮成怪物或蜘蛛侠之类的，所以每个人都假装成那个角色。

segments.en: Okay, so let's listen to her dialogue one more time and then we'll come back and talk some more.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们再听一遍她的对话，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: All right, drag her over here and help me tie her up.
segments.cn: 好吧，把她拖过来，帮我把她绑起来。

segments.en: I can't believe she fell for it.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信她掉进了圈套。

segments.en: She is a lot more gullible than I thought.
segments.cn: 她比我想象的要容易上当得多。

segments.en: Well, you gotta admit my acting was brilliant.
segments.cn: 好吧，你得承认我的表演很精彩。

segments.en: I was the one that convinced her to come.
segments.cn: 我是说服她来的那个人。

segments.en: The cat's out of the bag you witch.
segments.cn: 你这个女巫，秘密已经暴露了。
现在，我们想要一些答案。

segments.en: Okay, so what do you think will happen in part five?
segments.cn: 好吧，你认为第五部分会发生什么？

segments.en: Well, what do you guys think will happen in part five?
segments.cn: 那么，你们认为第五部分会发生什么？

segments.en: Apparently, Armand isn't a vampire anymore.
segments.cn: 显然，阿尔芒不再是吸血鬼了。

segments.en: What sort of twist are we gonna see here?
segments.cn: 我们会看到什么样的反转？

segments.en: We don't know what will happen.
segments.cn: 我们不知道会发生什么。

segments.en: But you can tell us what you think will happen.
segments.cn: 但你可以告诉我们你认为会发生什么。

segments.en: Come to our website at EnglishPod.com and leave all your questions and comments and maybe your story ideas.
segments.cn: 来到我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，留下你的问题和评论，也许还有你的故事创意。

segments.en: Yes, Marco and I are always around to answer your questions and to respond to your comments.
segments.cn: 是的，马尔科和我总是在这里回答你的问题和回应你的评论。

segments.en: Guys, I think we're out of time for today, but thanks for listening.
segments.cn: 各位，我想我们今天没时间了，但谢谢你的收听。

segments.en: And we'll see you next time.
